result.execSummary:
The defendant Fredrick W. Hodgkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 25% of the Defendant's income.   
AMENDED 4/9/16 - DOC SHALL DEDUCT MONIES AS ORDERED FROM DEFENDANT'S WAGES ONLY; CORRECTING AMENDED ORDER - WAS AMENDED 2/9/16
Must obtain/maintain full-time employment unless determined to be disabled or unable to work
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, in cluding needles, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Shall notify any prescribing professional that he is a herioin and other opiate addict; Shall have no contact with known drug users or dealers; shall refrain from any criminal contact
Shall submit a DNA sample; Shall write letter of apology to victims as approved by agent
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to sentence imposed in count 1

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Fredrick W. Hodgkins in court, in custody.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard, hearing regarding motion filed by def. Def heard regarding motion - not able order restitution on a prison sentence and def. atty should have objected. Atty Sempf heard, if def believes you cannot order restitution on a prison sentence would disagree. Discussion held. Court heard. Def heard. Court heard, does find Court had authority. Atty Sempf agrees. Court heard, motion is denied.

(9:38) Defendant Fredrick W. Hodgkins in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is sentencing hearing; all parties have rec'd and reviews PSI, no corrections or deletions; State recomm. 159 days credit, Atty. Jansen concurs; Court orders 159 days credit; victim rights complied with; no witnesses; State recomm. (10 years IC, 5 years ES, W/H and probation on Count 2); Atty. Jansen recomm. (2 yr. IC, 2 yr. ES w/1 yr. IC and 2 yr. ES); discussion on State's recomm.; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

Count 1: 5 years IC w/5 years ES - 159 days credit
* Conditions of ES:
- CC $268
- DNA sample and surcharge $250
- Rest. of $1,511.50 to Crime Victim Compensation Program; 25% of funds earned by Def./prisoner during incarceration to be paid toward restitution
- AODA and FT
- Other treatment deemed necessary in a confined setting
- Write letter of apology to victims as approved by Agent (has done so, to be turned over to Agent)
- Absolute sobriety, no bars, etc.
- maintaint FT employment, unless determined to be disabled/unable
- no drugs, etc. - shall notify any prescribing professional that he is a herioin and other opiates addict
- no possession of drug paraph., including needles
- no contact with known drug users or dealers
- no criminal contact

* Is eligible for CIP
* Is eligible for SAP
(NOT a reason for modification if it is found that Def. is not eligible for either of these programs)


Count 2: W/H sentence - 5 years PO consecutive to Count 1
* Same conditions as noted in Count 1
for extension of time to complete PSI
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
